programme.title: Wildest Middle East: Arabia: Land of Illusions
programme.desc: The Arabian peninsula is an ancient land of illusion. Extreme heat seems to sap life out of every corner. Yet, tricks of the light and the art of deception make survival possible. Nothing is as it seems.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Malaysia: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: Malaysia is one of a handful of countries in the world described as mega-diverse. Malaysia's animals and plants have exploited every opportunity to carve out an existence and so have adapted to some very strange ways of life.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Thailand: The Wild Heart
programme.desc: Thailand is a land of extremes. A country shaped by wild forces, where animals face tough challenges to survive. Tropical rainforests, primeval caves, mangrove swamps, and rocky shorelines provide homes for remarkable creatures.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Cambodia: The Water Kingdom
programme.desc: Cambodia's wildlife and climate is ruled by the monsoon cycle. It is a wild land of extreme rains, raging rivers and flooding lakes that create great challenges for its animals, and a fine balance between seasons.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Vietnam: Phoenix from the Ashes
programme.desc: Around 10% of the world's species live in Vietnam, with tropical jungles fit to burst with wildlife. But less than 50 years ago, things were very different. During the war, Vietnam's forests were decimated, but as it always does, life fought back.

programme.title: My All American

programme.title: The New Detectives: Face Of Tragedy

programme.title: The New Detectives: Bloodlust

programme.title: The New Detectives: Presumed Dead

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Andromeda

programme.desc: Sue Nicholson and Deb Webber investigate one of the most complex and intriguing cases ever featured - did Waikato man Jason Dark commit suicide or was he murdered, as his family believes?

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Your Lying Eyes
programme.desc: Kolani's on the run, left his wife to look after four kids and left Dog holding the bag for the $10k bond. So their pursuit on this case takes them into some parts of Ohau, and the human heart, that few of us will ever see.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Crime Don't Pay
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble - or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Twisted Love
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for car theft, but she's nowhere to be found. Her girlfriend and co-signer has gone missing too. Just when the trail goes cold, a friend leads the team to the cosigner's empty apartment.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Where the Wild Things Are
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and they face a special challenge - getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive. Robin disposed of a body after a homicide, and now he's skipped his court date.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: No Luv Still
programme.desc: Dog is in search of a potentially dangerous fugitive, he's only 19 and charged with kidnapping and menacing. The case takes an unexpected turn when the Chapman clan ends up in a confrontation with the suspect's family.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Day of the Dog
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Time to Cry
programme.desc: Kimo does a vanishing act for his day in court and now Dog and the posse have to find him. With precious few leads to follow Dog turns to the fugitive's on-again-off-again girlfriend, but she's initially reluctant to join the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Up on the Roof
programme.desc: Today, Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. When the adrenaline-fueled arrest goes down, every family member will play a critical role.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The West Monroe Wing

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Razing the Snakes
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Uneasy Rider
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead. Jase and the guys are inspired to design a product using zip lines that will revolutionize duck hunting.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Willie Hunting
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Sleep Cover
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drive-In Revivin'
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Fishful Thinking
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: When Doves Fry
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Carpnado
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Campfire Diaries
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Fifty SAR members from Princeton and Penticton SAR search for an elderly woman who disappeared.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Bears converge on an injured tree faller alone in the wilderness as Nelson SAR races to the scene.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Kent Harrison uses high tech sonar to help RCMP search for a missing camper.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: A snowmobiler trapped 30 metres down an icy crevasse says goodbye to his wife and family.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson SAR team up with a local psychic to find a missing person.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Rossland SAR employs high tech and local knowledge to search for missing skiers.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler SAR is on a mountain mission for missing friends who failed to show up for a landmark birthday party.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler SAR extracts a severely injured stunt snowmobiler. And later, teams search for two people swept down a raging river.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler Search and Rescue helicopter long-lines an injured snowmobiler off a steep mountainside.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Blame It on the Sun
programme.desc: When Milton came into Sona’s life, all the stars were aligned but now their relationship has been out of orbit. Sona is a firm believer in astrology and zodiac signs, but this Leo can no longer tolerate the cheating ways of Milton who is an Aries.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Secret Lies
programme.desc: Billy wants Marylu to quit pole dancing and stripping, while she wants Billy to confess if he’s straight or not. Billy has a fetish for wearing women’s underwear and he needs to fess up if he likes women, men or both.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Player of the Year
programme.desc: Jordan says that Taurean is the biggest player with the ladies and still decides to lie about it even after she gave him a chance to have an open relationship. He says he talks to other women because Jordan is unaffectionate and verbally abusive.

programme.title: Divorce Court: My Money
programme.desc: Barbara says Alicia is a cheater and a thief. Barbara's seen Alicia’s text messages from men and asserts she is verbally abusive and financially irresponsible. Alicia says Barbara is controlling, a liar, selfish and never committed to their marriage.

programme.title: Divorce Court: I Scream U Scream
programme.desc: Sharee moved in with Brandon shortly after they met, had a child and still no marriage. Brandon wants her to get a full-time job and not work part-time in their business before they get married.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Coming to America
programme.desc: Keith claims he is married to two other women overseas and plans to bring them over! Paw'lla says Keith is a fake pastor who doesn't know what he's talking about! Keith says he has a master plan for all of these wives!

programme.title: Divorce Court: Studs Need Love Too
programme.desc: Tahani said Cymbre's jealous fits of rage has caused her to lose a job and suspects him of cheating after finding a hotel receipt! He doesn't trust her either after she cheated before. Will this couple be able to trust again or are they too far gone?

programme.title: Divorce Court: To the Left
programme.desc: This relationship between high school sweethearts has turned sour. Tonesha, though she converted to Islam for Theotis, says he still has a lot of growing up to do before they get married.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Computer Love
programme.desc: As soon as this couple got engaged their romance hit the rocks. Brandi says that Brittanie can’t tell the truth if her life depended on it. Brittanie says Brandi’s insecurities and lack of trust has had a severe effect on their relationship.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Angry Man
programme.desc: Kadaveion and Justice’s anger issues are tearing them apart. Kadaveion doubts he fathered their baby, but Justice says he’s a liar who gave her a STD and is ready to leave him. Can Judge Toler find a solution or have they already made up their minds?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Sixth Sense
programme.desc: Takashia says Brendon doesn’t approve of her friends, doesn’t trust her and is controlling. Brendon says he can’t trust Takashia because she is a nonstop attention seeker and never passes up an opportunity to flirt with men.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Lonely Nights
programme.desc: Christina says Ramon is a cheater, runs from his financial responsibilities and their sex life is in the gutter. He’s tired of her enabling his family to the point, he takes refuge in hotel rooms to get a break from her.

programme.title: Run's House: Downward Facing Dawg

programme.title: Run's House: Anger Management
programme.desc: Mom and Dad express concern over Russy's temper and decide to get professional help.

programme.title: Run's House: Baby Booming
programme.desc: When Angela decides that she needs a new dog as a fashion accessory Rev puts his foot down.

programme.title: Run's House: Victoria Anne Simmons
programme.desc: Season three picks up with a very pregnant Justine and an anxious family awaiting the birth of their new child and sibling.

programme.title: Run's House: Hangin' with Run
programme.desc: Rev Run notices that Jojo isn't spending much time at home, instead, opting to hang out with his friends away from home.

programme.title: Run's House: Sneaker Pimps & Mini Moguls

programme.title: Paranormal State: Get Out of This House

programme.title: Paranormal State: Dead Legends

programme.desc: When a woman has long scratch marks mysteriously appear on her back, PRS is called in to see if they are truly facing the devil. But her credibility is called into question, a struggle of another kind emerges for Ryan and the rest of the team.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Dark Man

programme.title: Paranormal State: Paranormal Detour
programme.desc: With time off between cases, Ryan suggests to the PRS team they choose a random town to investigate. They roll into St. Helens, Oregon, home of Twilight, where they learn about the long history of the paranormal in the area.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Southern Discomfort At Sweetwater Mansion

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Fire
programme.desc: Christina has been experiencing paranormal activity ever since her father and step-mother were murdered near Columbus, OH last year. PRS and psychic/medium?Chip Coffey delve into a open murder case and wind up exposing a family divide.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Cemetery
programme.desc: PRS visits a gothic graveyard, where a jealous spirit seems to be preying on the newlywed wife of the cemetery's caretaker. Ryan traces the haunting to a mysterious, unclaimed cremation urn on the grounds.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Glove
programme.desc: When a terrifying haunting threatens to break a Daisytown, PA couple apart, PRS is their last resort. As the investigation deepens, PRS and the family learn that it's just the tip of iceberg, turns out this haunting might be all in the family.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: As the team split up the fear become palpable. Without the safety of numbers the team are feeling they are being stalked and Glen comes face to face with some unexplained physical phenomena.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: With the team on edge, they explore deeper into the darkness of this incredible place of mystery and secrets. Is the feeling of unease just in their minds or is something about to reveal itself.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: The team are still spread thinly across this huge location and without the safety of numbers some of the investigators seem easy prey.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Sheffield
programme.desc: This week Kirstie and Phil are house hunting in Sheffield. Fire fighter Justin and his sales manager wife Deborah have got £250k burning a hole in their back pocket and they're desperate to find the perfect do-up property to settle down in.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Yorkshire & Guildford
programme.desc: After winning one point eight million on the lottery, they needed a new house.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Warning
programme.desc: Caress discovers Emily and Ben's secret and Blake is double-crossed by an old friend. Alexis schemes to turn the Chinese government against Blake; Claudia threatens to reveal Adam's power of attorney over Denver-Carrington.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Cry
programme.desc: Blake is tricked into borrowing money from Alexis; Jackie returns home to some shocking news; Blake learns the identity of the woman who can save his reputation; ignored by family and taunted by a reporter, Amanda attempts suicide.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Rescue
programme.desc: The guilt-ridden Alexis fears she is too late when she finds Amanda unconscious; Dominique proposes to Garrett; Steven believes he may lose Danny to Sammy Jo and Clay; Ben makes special plans for Caress and Alexis.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Triple-Cross
programme.desc: Successfully proving Blake and Alexis dishonorable, Ben is given control of the South China Sea leases; Steven attempts to uncover Adam's secret; Dominique's wedding day approaches; Sammy Jo and Clay find romance by candlelight.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Vendetta
programme.desc: Blake attacks Alexis when she attempts to take over the mansion; an emotionally disturbed Claudia is trapped by a wall of flame; Sammy Jo and Amanda fight for Clay's affections; Dominique learns the truth about Garrett's first marriage.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Victory
programme.desc: Alexis's life is spared as Krystle is able to restrain Blake's lethal temper; as La Mirage burns, Amanda is rescued by a mysterious stranger; Claudia is claimed victim by the ravaging flames.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.20
programme.desc: Woman accuses ex of cheating in her home, he sues for furniture disposal and clothes destruction/Woman sues ex-roommate for back rent amid marijuana accusations, countersued for damaged property cost.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.203
programme.desc: A Malibu man claiming he was tired of being a “cabana boy” for his older girlfriend is sued for allegedly stealing her tools and making unauthorized charges on her credit card.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.156
programme.desc: Woman provides home and job for pregnant student denying misconduct. Woman admits to damaging boyfriend's car but denies debt, citing payment for his prison phone bill.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.56

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.162
programme.desc: Teen sues ex-friend for burns and stolen laptop, countersued for harassment. Adult entertainment sued for refund after male dancers disrupt birthday party.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.37
programme.desc: Parents allegedly renege on owed money for son's wedding after not being invited/Woman sues child's father for false domestic violence accusation upon discovering love note to wife in Tunisia.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.141
programme.desc: Alleged assaults and vicious scratching, rumors about injuring a child, and unpaid bills divide ex-lovers. Paternity tests and trailer storage come into play when a woman sues her daughter’s former friend for 13 months worth of rent.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.40
programme.desc: Electrician denies vandalizing home, stealing materials post-firing. Expert witness called for damages/Woman sues ex for furniture return; he claims she gave it when moving out.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.83
programme.desc: Judge Judy bets a year’s salary that a young man didn’t declare certain earnings on his tax return. He is sued by an ex-lover for loans, a hotel room, and a digital camera.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.249
programme.desc: A woman sues her son for eviction fees and stopping payment on an apartment. A teen's father breaks his son's phone used for alleged drug purchases, leaving the other teen's father with the bill.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.147
programme.desc: Teen accused of car vandalism; alleges pepper spray incident. Teen uses loan for stepfather's rims; sues for repayment and totaled car balance.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Flights
programme.desc: Our experience of the world’s greatest marvels is literally and figuratively elevated when we explore them from the air. Whether you travel by air balloon, helicopter, light aircraft, a grand perspective is always guaranteed.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Wetland Animals
programme.desc: Wetland Animals dives into the swamps, rivers, and flood plains of the Everglades, Botswana’s Okavango Delta, Kakadu National Park in Australia, and the Amazon to see deadly crocodiles, piranhas, hippopotamus, flamingo, manatee, and platypus.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Forest Animals
programme.desc: Forest Animals gets up close with bears, koalas, moose, wolves, weaver ants, and Tasmanian Devils. This episode roves dark forests floors and soars above vast canopies of green in America, China, Laos, and Australia.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Bridges
programme.desc: A bridge is a structure that’s designed to transcend, but a great bridge can define the place where it stands. Symbols of human ingenuity, beauty, and grandeur, bridges connect us not only to each other but also to the past.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Volcanoes
programme.desc: There are few sights on earth as compelling as a volcanic eruption. Volcanoes have the potential to cause death and widespread destruction in a heartbeat, but they also give rise to new life and ecosystems.

programme.title: Arthur: The Curse of the Grebes/Arthur Changes Gears
programme.desc: The Elwood City Grebes haven't won the Baseball Championship since 1918. But with the addition of three players, the title is finally within reach. Arthur finally saves enough money to buy the bike of his dreams!

programme.title: Arthur: Two Minutes/Messy Dress Mess
programme.desc: Power shifts in the Tibble household when the twins find out Tommy is two minutes older than Timmy. Ladonna's thrilled when Muffy loans her a beautiful recital dress, but a run-in with a painted bench creates a problem.

programme.title: Arthur: The Perfect Game/D.W.'s Furry Freakout
programme.desc: Francine is excited about a school project, but she's so obsessed with making it perfect that she can't seem to get anything done at all. When D.W. finds a stray kitten, it soon turns out to be a lot more than D.W. can handle.

programme.title: Arthur: The Boy With His Head In The Clouds/More!
programme.desc: All the kids know that George is smart--so why does he sometimes have trouble reading and writing? Then, D.W. is thrilled to be getting an allowance. At last, she'll be rich and powerful!

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Adds It Up/Wish You Were Here
programme.desc: Math, schmath. That's what Sue Ellen thinks… until she runs into a problem her artistic vision can't solve. Sue Ellen can't wait to meet her pen pal in person.

programme.title: Arthur: Francine's Pilfered Paper/Buster Gets Real
programme.desc: When Francine has a big paper over Thanksgiving, she copies from a website. There's nothing wrong with that, is there? Everyone loves the new Top Supermarket reality series on TV, except Arthur. Will it end his friendship with Buster?

programme.title: Arthur: Double Tibble Trouble/Arthur's Almost Live Not Real Music Festival
programme.desc: Playing with the Tibble twins requires preparation, endurance and earplugs. But when one gets sick, playing with the other should be a lot easier, right? Arthur and the gang create their own music videos.

programme.title: Arthur: Citizen Frensky/D.W.'S Backpack Mishap
programme.desc: After visiting The Elwood City Times, Francine decides to start her own paper--The Frensky Star! The tabloid is a success--until all her friends stop speaking to her. Somebody stole D.W.'s backpack!! Who is this fluffy unicorn thief?

programme.title: Arthur: The Chips Are Down/Revenge Of The Chip
programme.desc: What a mysterious, beautiful thing a green potato chip is--and D.W. just ate a gigantic one! But then she hears a rumor that they're poisonous...Sure, kids do some pretty embarrassing things, but do Moms have to tell everyone?

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: Vidkun Quisling
programme.desc: Vidkun Quisling, once honored for diplomacy, turned traitor by collaborating with Nazis. His bid for power in Norway failed, relegated by Germans. Despite being named "fuehrer," his reign led to repression until his hanging post-Nazi defeat.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Devil's Due
programme.desc: During WWII, Greek Prime Ministers Tsolakoglou, Logothetopoulos, and Rallis collaborated with Nazi occupiers, imposing fees that caused a famine.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Croatian Collaborator
programme.desc: Croatia grapples with its fascist past through figures like Dinko Sakic, once hailed as a hero but later convicted of war crimes. Leading the notorious Jasenovac camp, Sakic oversaw brutal atrocities against inmates.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Belgian Collaborator
programme.desc: Leon Degrelle, a charismatic Belgian leader, joined the Nazis and led Die Wallonien on the Eastern Front. Despite no military background, he earned the Knight's Cross for valor. He recruited 4000 more for the SS, defending Berlin until April 1945.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: Traitor-in-Chief
programme.desc: Pierre Laval, once celebrated and later reviled, faced execution in 1945 for collaboration with the Nazis during Vichy France. Originally a socialist and pacifist, he fell into collaboration for power and to navigate the horrors of occupation.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Mike and Caroline
programme.desc: Mike fell in love with Caroline online. He grew suspicious when she continually evaded meeting him, yet left notes at his car. Is Caroline an imposter or is she just afraid? (S2, ep16)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Caitlyn calls on Nev and Max to help separate the fact from fiction of her courtship with Kenton. Kenton insists she and her daughter move to Kentucky but is Kenton all he claims to be? (S6, ep20)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Harold & Armani
programme.desc: Harold found his match with a beautiful fellow jock named Armani. Although they live in the same area, they've never met. Nev is joined by Angel Haze to help Harold get his perfect girl. (S4, ep3)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Miranda & Cameryn
programme.desc: After years of online chats Miranda discovered that Cameryn was not the man he claimed to be. She confronted him only to be given another suspicious profile. Is he someone else entirely?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Jasmine & Mike
programme.desc: Jasmine has been texting with Mike for two years and thinks he could be the perfect step-father for her son. Although they live only 15 minutes apart, the pair have yet to meet up in person.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Ashley & Mike
programme.desc: For over seven years, Ashley has sent dramatically altered photos of herself to her soul mate, Mike, to make her look thinner and more attractive to him.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Tiana & James
programme.desc: After a three-year online relationship, Tiana moved across the country to be with love-of-her-life James, and reveal her secret. Now in the same state, James seems more elusive than ever. (S4, ep11)

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 114
programme.desc: Bryan and Megan have been best friends for 10 years and he can no longer keep his feeling contained. Kenise thinks that she and James can be more than workout buddies.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 115
programme.desc: Arty Krystal confesses her love to unsuspecting friend Nishell. Mike tells gal pal Rachel that he's in love with her.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 116
programme.desc: Alex tells his best friend's sister that he has strong feelings for her. Asha tells her friend Chris that she wants more than friendship.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 117
programme.desc: Aja confesses her feelings to best friend Charles. Paulie tries to convince his friend Bethany that there is more between them that just friendship!

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 118
programme.desc: Danielle loves to laugh and joke with Chris, but now she wants to get serious with him. Jenni met Christie about a year ago and now she's ready to bare her heart.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 119
programme.desc: Nicole wants to make her best friend of a year and a half her boyfriend. Andrew and Sarah have been friends for 5 years now he's ready to reveal his true feelings.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 120
programme.desc: Franklin needs to let Erica, his friend of 5 years, know how he really feels about her. Wayne, a rapper, reveals his true feelings to Megan.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 121
programme.desc: Ladies man, Sid, must put aside his pimping ways to tell his best friend Courtney how he feels. Scott let's best friend Laruen know he wants to take it to the next level.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 122
programme.desc: Melita must tell Marcus how she feels before he leaves for the military. Gaming nerd Brian, tells Samantha that he's in love with her.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 101
programme.desc: Connor is in love with his best friend Brittanie and must try to convince her that he should be more than her "shopping partner." Gabby reveals her feelings to her best friend Nick.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 102
programme.desc: Heather must convince her best friend Gary that she's more than "one of the guys", while Kevin tries to prove to Janine that nice guys finish first.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Negotiators
programme.desc: An inside look at 23-year-old Jarrett Jordan, a disturbed man who shot three people and barricaded himself in a house in Queens, NY. He had with him his four-month-old daughter and three hostages.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Crime and Punishment
programme.desc: Two women fight to keep the man convicted of killing their mother over 20 years earlier in prison, though he maintains his innocence.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Murder in the Fast Lane
programme.desc: A report on the March 1988 murder of legendary racecar driver Mickey Thompson and his wife Trudy. Thompson’s sister is convinced that Michael Goodwin, her brother’s former partner, was the killer.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: In 1986, 21-year-old Mitzi Nalley was brutally murdered in her Austin, Texas home. Police arrested Jonathan Wayne Nobles, who confessed to the crime and was sentenced to the death penalty.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Body of Lies
programme.desc: In 2006, 31-year-old Leisha Hurst, while attending Barstow College, began dating fellow student, 34-year-old Jeami Chiapulis. Chiapulis seemed to be the man she could settle down with. The couple had plans to marry when Hurst vanished on January 22, 2009

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Rip Van Kitty/Grabbity/The Big Catnap

programme.desc: Garfield and Odie are snowbound in a cabin with no food./A monster circulates around the farm, Orson dons his "Power Pig" togs./Garfield dreams he changes places with Jon.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends

programme.desc: Garfield dreams of being pioneers in outer space./Roy gets a watch for his birthday./Jon's attempt to break a habit by listening to a record in his sleep.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubbies watch some children play a game with their fingers. A voice trumpet rises and sings the nursery rhyme ‘Ring-a-Roses’ to the Teletubbies.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies dance a walking dance. They stop to watch a group of children are riding on a rickshaw. In Teletubbyland, Po is riding her scooter.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy leaves his hat behind, but when he comes to find it. The Noo-noo has tidied up. The Teletubbies watch some children style their friend Rosie’s hair.

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch a little boy and his dad play basketball. The Tubbies are very careful not to drop their Tubby Toast, but when Tinky Winky has an accident, the Noo Noo tidies up.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies walk in sideways, then run off to watch a little boy play cricket with his dad. In Teletubbyland,Tinky Winky runs away with Laa-Laa’s ball. Laa-Laa chases after him, through the house, over the hills and behind the trees.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Bryony loves to play the violin. She talks about her violin and they plays 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star'. The Teletubbies sit down to listen to some lovely music, but the Noo Noo is making too much noise.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Scoop and Skip are helping Mr Beasley to install a new Rockery when Mr Bentley appears to ask for Bob’s help. The Mayor wants to stage an art exhibition, but there are no available venues. Scoop suggests renovating the inside of the Old Mill.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Fothergill has a nasty case of dry rot, so Bob and crew will have to use some smelly chemicals to fix it. As these will affect Mr Fothergill’s allergies, he goes to his sister’s for the day. But she doesn’t get on with Hamish, his pet parrot.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Whilst Bob and the team build Annie Pickles new seafront house, Muck is worried that Scoop is a better digger than he is and decides to prove himself with a sandcastle competition.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob has been asked to install a new air conditioning unit at Mr Sabatini’s restaurant. Wendy and Molly meanwhile have been asked to redecorate the library at the school.

programme.title: When Bob Became a Builder
programme.desc: It’s a beautiful day in Sunflower Valley and Bob and his machine team are building a new picnic area at the beach. Dizzy, Lofty and Scrambler are clearing stuff that’s been washed up on the beach, while Benny has a great time digging with Scoop and Muck.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Farmer Pickles has decided to open a camp site on his land, and Bob is installing a shower block and fence to keep the sheep out. For once, he is working on his own while Wendy goes on holiday with Jenny.

programme.title: Bob's Big Plan
programme.desc: When Bob and the team are building an extension to the offices of Mr Adams the local architect, Bob hears of a competition to build a brand new town in nearby Sunflower Valley, a place Bob knows very well from his childhood. Mr Adams shows Bob his idea.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is replacing a potting shed on Mr Beasley’s allotment. In the old shed is a chest which Mr Beasley doesn’t need any more. Meanwhile Wendy calls at JJ’s for the materials for the new shed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is erecting a tent to accommodate some newcomers to the valley. Mr Bentley is organising everything, but unfortunately leaves his phone with Spud who promptly declares himself ‘Mr Bentley’s Assistant’.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Ellis has a batch of Doves delivered, to use in his magic act, and asks Bob to build a dovecote for his new birds to live in. Mr Ellis realises that he has to go to work but does not want to leave the birds at home alone.

programme.title: Race to the Finish
programme.desc: Mayor Bentley announces that Sunflower Valley is to stage its very first athletics tournament. A team from Sunflower Valley is to compete against a team of visiting athletes. Plus there is to be a special machine event!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Robert and Dot, Bob’s Mum and Dad are visiting the Valley. Bob shows them around, pointing out their recycling storeroom. Robert notices Bob’s old rubble chute. Bob explains that he hasn’t had much use for it out in the valley.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob’s job today is to repair an eroded riverbank. There will be LOTS of mud to shift and Muck is beside himself with excitement. Before Muck can get stuck in, Bob needs him to fetch some equipment from JJ’s.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Vanished
programme.desc: Some who were detained during the Resistance sweep have not reappeared after their release. Lili is taken to a lab run by Sandoval and implanted. Renee tries to help Liam find the missing people.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Emancipation
programme.desc: A group posing as volunteers attacks using a stolen skrill prototype that does not require an implant to control. It is discovered that the skrill queen is also missing. The investigation leads to a resistance group called Black Wednesday.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Déjà Vu
programme.desc: A joint Doors International/Taelon venture creates a machine that allows people to vividly relive a memory, but Liam suspects a back alley version of the device is leading to the death of some users.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Once and Future World

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Thicker than Blood

programme.title: The Lost World: Paradise Found

programme.title: The Lost World: The Beast Within
programme.desc: Malone goes after a healer that's been filled with the spirit of a demon in exchange for safe release from the village. The girls must set their differences aside and learn to trust each other.

programme.title: The Lost World: Creatures of the Dark
programme.desc: Challenger tries to convince an underground civilization of the dangers of an active volcano ready to blow. In the meantime Veronica, Roxton, and Summerlee try to outrun the Vantu.

programme.title: The Lost World: Tribute
programme.desc: Challenger, Roxton, and Veronica teach the Tintas how to retaliate against the Hikari so that they may be independent. Meanwhile Marguerite, Summerlee, and Malone help a WWI pilot fix his plane.

programme.title: The Lost World: Absolute Power
programme.desc: A powerful light ray from an ancient temple knocks Professor Challenger unconscious. As the explorers try and save him, he occupies an alternate reality in his mind where he has godlike powers.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Hermione Norris and John Thomson join up with Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon on a classic car trip through Cornwall, aiming to buy antiques for auction in London. On the way, John learns nautical history and Hermione takes off.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts trade homes for antiques! Paired up with experts James Braxton and James Lewis, they scour Hampshire in search of bargains to sell at auction for profit--to benefit Children in Need.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Teen Mom UK
programme.desc: Chloe lands a big lingerie campaign but she's terrified to take her clothes off. It's a big day for Ste as he goes for his ADHD assessment. Mia struggles to juggle mum life and work. (S8, ep5)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Tasheeka & Aaron
programme.desc: After avoiding video calls for 2 years, Tasheeka is desperate to find out if Aaron is her Prince Charming. It's up to Julie and Oobah to see if this online romance has a fairy tale ending. (S1, ep3)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Emma & Harry
programme.desc: After six months, single mum Emma and online love Harry have already set a wedding date. But the problem is, they've never met. So it's up to the Catfish UK team to track him down. (S1, ep8)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Jerry & Karla
programme.desc: Jerry needs help meeting his first love Karla. Karla claims to have already met Jerry but refuses to talk to him on the phone. Can Oobah and Nella find out if Karla is who she says she is? (S2, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Esther & Theo
programme.desc: Esther's finally found her match in Theo. But he always refuses to video call. So it's up to Julia and Oobah to find out if Theo is who he says he is. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Lost in Paradise
programme.desc: In 1976, Deborah Gardner, a Peace Corps worker, was murdered while on assignment in the South Pacific island nation of Tonga. Dennis Priven, a 24-year-old fellow Peace Corps worker, who appeared to be obsessed with Gardner, was charged by Tongan police.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Where's Our Baby?
programme.desc: In November 1997, Marlene and Steve Aisenberg reported their five-month-old daughter Sabrina missing from her crib. Police soon focused on the parents as authorities became convinced that they knew more about the baby’s disappearance than they admitted.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: Elizabeth Welsh's husband, Patrick, left her and their two sons what appeared to be a suicide note and disappeared. After investigating the situation, Elizabeth discovered that Patrick is still alive, living in Texas.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Accused
programme.desc: In 1996 the car which Sheila Bryan was driving with her mother as passenger accidentally veered off the road and into a ditch killing her mother. Sheila was charged with murder -- then tried, convicted, and sentenced to life imprisonment.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Scared to Death
programme.desc: Police Lt. Jim Barton found his wife, Vickie, murdered execution-style on their farm in Warren County, Ohio, in 1995. With limited physical evidence and no suspects, the investigation lay dormant for nine years until a tip opened the case.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Why Did Josh Kill?
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Maddie Clifton of Jacksonville, Florida went outside to play and never came back. Seven days later a city-wide search led to the home of Josh Phillips, a 14-year-old neighbor, where Maddie's body was found under the boy's waterbed.
